skill.name: brand-guidelines
skill.description: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit from having Anthropic's look-and-feel. Use it when brand colors or style guidelines, visual formatting, or company design standards apply.
skill.summary: Applies Anthropic's official brand colors and typography to any sort of artifact that may benefit fr...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only brand guidelines information. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access detected. This skill provides color hex codes and typography recommendations for visual styling.

content.value_statement: Create professional documents and presentations with Anthropic's brand identity. This skill provides official colors and typography guidelines to ensure consistent visual styling across all your artifacts.
actual_capabilities: Applies Anthropic brand color palette including dark, light, and accent colors
Specifies typography guidelines with Poppins for headings and Lora for body text
Provides automatic font fallback to Arial and Georgia when custom fonts unavailable
Guides text styling with smart color selection based on background
Applies accent colors to non-text shapes and design elements
Ensures consistent visual hierarchy and formatting
limitations: Does not generate documents or presentations automatically
Requires python-pptx or similar library for programmatic color application
Custom fonts (Poppins, Lora) may not be installed on all systems
Skill provides guidelines only; actual implementation depends on the tool being used

use_cases.title: Style Presentations
use_cases.description: Create on-brand slide decks and visual presentations with consistent Anthropic styling

use_cases.title: Format Documentation
use_cases.description: Apply corporate branding to technical documents, guides, and internal communications

use_cases.title: Design Marketing Materials
use_cases.description: Maintain brand consistency across promotional content and external communications

prompt_templates.title: Apply Brand Colors
prompt_templates.scenario: Style a presentation with Anthropic colors
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Anthropic brand guidelines skill to apply the official color palette to this presentation. Use dark (#141413) for primary text, light (#faf9f5) for backgrounds, and the orange accent (#d97757) for key elements.

prompt_templates.title: Set Typography
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply Anthropic's typography guidelines to this document. Set Poppins font for all headings 24pt and larger, and use Lora for body text with Georgia as fallback.

prompt_templates.title: Design On-Brand Slide
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a title slide using Anthropic brand guidelines. Include the orange (#d97757) accent color for the title, light background (#faf9f5), and Poppins font for the heading.

prompt_templates.title: Create Visual Assets
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a diagram using Anthropic's accent color palette. Rotate through orange (#d97757), blue (#6a9bcc), and green (#788c5d) for different shapes while maintaining brand consistency.

output_examples.input: Style this presentation with Anthropic brand guidelines
output: Brand colors applied: Dark #141413 for headings, Light #faf9f5 for background
Typography: Poppins font for titles, Lora for body text with fallback
Accent colors: Orange #d97757 used for call-to-action elements
Visual hierarchy maintained with consistent spacing and color contrast

best_practices: Pre-install Poppins and Lora fonts in your environment for best visual results
Use the full accent color palette (orange, blue, green) to add visual interest while staying on-brand
Apply dark (#141413) text on light backgrounds and light (#faf9f5) text on dark backgrounds for accessibility
anti_patterns: Using non-brand colors for primary elements instead of the official palette
Applying custom fonts without verifying they are available on the target system
Ignoring the color contrast requirements between text and background colors

faq.question: What tools work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides guidelines that can be applied through python-pptx or similar document generation libraries.

faq.question: Do I need to install fonts?
faq.answer: Poppins and Lora fonts are recommended but optional. The skill includes automatic fallback to Arial for headings and Georgia for body text.

faq.question: Can I use these colors in web projects?
faq.answer: Yes, the hex color codes work for any web or digital project. The RGB values also support programmatic applications like python-pptx.

faq.question: Is this an official Anthropic skill?
faq.answer: This is a community-created skill providing brand guidelines. Verify current brand standards at official Anthropic channels for production use.

faq.question: What file formats support these colors?
faq.answer: Colors can be applied to any format supporting hex or RGB values including presentations, documents, diagrams, and web content.

faq.question: How do I handle dark mode documents?
faq.answer: Use light color (#faf9f5) for text on dark backgrounds. The mid-gray (#b0aea5) works well for secondary text elements.
